title: Pembrokeshire League
text:
The Pembrokeshire League (currently the "Manderwood Pembrokeshire League") is a <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> league in <a href="Pembrokeshire">Pembrokeshire</a>, <a href="West%20Wales">West Wales</a>, running from levels five to nine of the <a href="Welsh%20football%20league%20system">Welsh football league system</a>.
Teams promoted from Division One may enter the <a href="West%20Wales%20Premier%20League">West Wales Premier League</a> if standards and facilities fall into line with the regulations of the <a href="Welsh%20Football%20League">Welsh Football League</a>.
The Pembrokeshire League also enters teams into the <a href="WWFA%20Intermediate%20Cup">West Wales Intermediate Cup</a>, to play against clubs from the <a href="Carmarthenshire%20League">Carmarthenshire League</a>, <a href="Neath%20%26amp%3B%20District%20League">Neath & District League</a> and <a href="Swansea%20Senior%20League">Swansea Senior League</a>. With Merlins Bridge beating fellow Pembrokeshire league side Carew in the 2019 final, this meant 4 of the last 7 winners had been Pembrokeshire League teams. 
History.
Newspaper articles from the early 1900s show the league existed in the pre-World War One period. The league was reformed for the 1945–46 season, and has played continuously since.

Pembrokeshire Senior Cup.
The league's main cup competition, the <a href="Pembrokeshire%20Senior%20Cup">Pembrokeshire Senior Cup</a> has been in operation since 1946-47.
